application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Erection of a single-storey ground floor rear extension including a rear pergola and rebuilding of boundary wall; installation of flank window at upper ground floor level; replacement of windows in the front and rear elevations.
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>Full details, with samples, of the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the buildings, including glazing, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before any work on the site is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved. </p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area</p>

Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be implemented in full prior to the first occupation/use of the development and retained in perpetuity.


a) Detailed specification of at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof, permeable paving etc.). 


REASON: To ensure that the development will provide a sustainable drainage system.

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of two Swift nesting bricks and/or boxes shall be provided at or close to eaves level of the development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of biodiversity</p>
